title: Armero
paragraph: 23,080 people died from the avalanche that occurred in Armero, Colombia
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: On the night of November 13, 1985, the most important natural disaster in the history of Colombia occurred
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: "When I flew over the first time, I saw hundreds of people signaling to me that they were alive, asking for help. When I went through the second time, they were many less"
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: On November 13, 1985, it was marked in the memory of Colombians as the day Armero disappeared from the map
author: El Heraldo, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: An avalanche of mud and lava caused by the eruption of the Nevado del Ruiz volcano ended the lives of more than 23,000 people.
author: El Heraldo, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: "My mom was saved, but all her relatives died and she did not recover emotionally. She died of a cancer that is not removed with chemotherapy: sadness". Inhabitant of Armero
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: After 69 years of inactivity, the Nevado del Ruiz volcano awoke and caused the most catastrophic avalanche in the history of Colombia.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: 23 thousand people, 94% of Armero was the balance left by the avalanche of Nevado del Ruiz
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: There was a week in which we completed 12 cans of 55 gallons each with parts of human bodies.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: If someday they ask me how I imagine the end of the world, I would answer that it must be like this: stumbling over death at every step
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: A place that after being at the mercy of hot mud, gave way to the cold of loneliness, the cold of death.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: Leopoldo Guevara, flew over the area in his plane. He tried to give notice. But nobody believed him.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: No body believed him. Neither the Secretary General of the Presidency, nor a general, nor two gurus of national journalism. Not even President Belisario Betancur.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: Armero is located 65 kilometers from the Nevado del Ruiz volcano. The avalanche slipped to about 300 kilometers per hour. Avalanche of mud of four meters high in this area.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: A 13-year-old girl became the universal symbol of the tragedy: Omaira Sánchez. Her agony of 72 hours, in front of journalists from different media, moved everyone.
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

paragraph: 263 children who survived the avalanche of the night of that November 13, were given up for adoption or simply welcomed by someone without a trace
author: El País, Colombia, 2015

title: Rumania
paragraph: There are currently 772 buildings with seismic risk in Bucharest and only 79 such buildings have been consolidated in the last 27 years, according to official data from the Bucharest City Hall.
author: Romania insider, 2017

paragraph: On March 4th 1977, at magnitude 7.2 earthquake shook Romania's seismically active Vrancea region
author: Code for All, Medium

paragraph: The earthquake in Rumania exacted a heavy toll: almost 1,600 dead, of which 1,400 in Bucharest
author: Code for All, Medium

paragraph: It was the deadliest earthquake in Romanian history. 11,000 wounded, 32,000 buildings damaged or destroyed and over 35,000 left homeless.
author: Code for All, Medium

title: Sichuan earthquake
paragraph: 12 May 2008, total numbers of deaths: 87476
author: The Guardian, UK

title: Cyclone Nargis
paragraph: 2 May 2008, total numbers of deaths:138366
author: The Guardian, UK

paragraph: Mexico received an earthquake of 8.4 magnitude, the epicenter was focused on the state of Jalisco. There is no record of fatalities
author: La Data, México, 2017

paragraph: The most costly urban disaster of the last decade was the Bam earthquake in Iran, in 2003, which left damages totalling US$500m
author: The Guardian, UK

paragraph: The deadliest disaster was the South Asian tsunami in 2004, which effected 7 countries and killed 226,408
author: The Guardian, UK

title: Japan earthquake and tsunami
paragraph: 11 March 2011, total number of deaths: 5178
author: The Guardian, UK

paragraph: In Japan an earthquake of 8.9 degrees on the Richter scale devastated the north of the archipelago and caused hundreds of deaths
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: An earthquake in the sea caused a gigantic tsunami, with waves that reached 10 meters high and swept the northeast coast of Japan.
author: El País, 2011

title: Haiti earthquake
paragraph: 12 January 2010, total numbers of deaths: 222570
author: The Guardian, UK

paragraph: A strong earthquake of magnitude 7.3 on the Richter scale shook Haiti, the poorest country in the Americas, and set off the alarm in the Caribbean.
author: El País, 2010

paragraph: Shortly after the first shake Haiti had three replicas, one of 5.9 on the Richter scale and another of 5.5 and the last of 5.1.
author: El País, 2010

title: México earthquake 2017
paragraph: Mexico experienced an earthquake on September 19, 1985, which hit the country at that time. It also experienced an earthquake on September 19, 2017.
author: La Data, México, 2017

paragraph: In the 2017 earthquake there were 369 deaths, 228 in Mexico City, 74 in the state of Morelos, 45 in Puebla, 15 in the State of Mexico, 6 in Guerrero and one in Oaxaca
author: La Data, México, 2017

paragraph: During the rescue activities of the 2017 earthquake, 69 people were taken alive from the rubble
author: La Data, México, 2017

paragraph: 369 people died after the earthquake struck México on September 19, 2017. 228 of them in México City.
author: CNN Español, 2018

paragraph: Mexico received more than 664 tons, consisting of water, canned food, basic necessities and medical supplies.
author: La Data, México, 2017

title: Indonesia tsunami
paragraph: More than 1400 people died by the earthquake and the tsunami on the indonesian island Celebes.
author: El Comercio, 2018

paragraph: The majority of victims are from Palu, a city of 335000 citizens.
author: El Mundo, 2018

paragraph: There's about 59000 camping tents of displaced people, says the autorities.
author: El Mundo, 2018

paragraph: The UN has warned that at least 46000 underage needs help in Indonesia.
author: El País, 2018

title: Southeast Asian tsunami 2004
paragraph: This tsunami occurred on December 26, 2004, affecting the countries of Indonesia, India, Sri Lanka or Thailand.
author: El Mundo, 2014

paragraph: The tsunami was originated due to a 9.1 magnitude earthquake that hit the Indian Ocean with an epicenter on the island of Sumatra, Indonesia.
author: El Mundo, 2014

paragraph: It is estimated that at least 230,000 people lost their lives due to the tsunami in Southeast Asia
author: El Mundo, 2014

paragraph: The most affected countries were Indonesia with 160,000 dead, 35,000 in Sri Lanka, 16,000 in India and 8,000 in Thailand
author: El Mundo, 2014

paragraph: The Southeast Asian tsunami was caused by an earthquake in the deep sea, which caused a mountain of water about 15 meters high and 2 kilometers long that rushed with a speed of 700 kilometers per hour.
author: El Mundo, 2014

title: EE.UU Hurricane Florence
paragraph: Hurricane Florence caused up to $22 billion in damages. Climate change made the storm worse.
author: Vox, 2018

paragraph: At least 50 people died as a result of Hurricane Florence
author: Vox, 2018

title: Hurricane Sandy
paragraph: Hurricane Sandy left 147 people dead (in several countries)
author: CNN Español, 2017

title: Hurricane Andrew
paragraph: Hurricane Andrew struck at dawn on August 24, 1992 over Miami-Dade County.
author: Inforbae, 2017

paragraph: Hurricane Andrew had a category 5 on the Saffir-Simpson intensity scale, the maximum, with maximum sustained winds of 165 miles per hour (265 km / h).
author: Inforbae, 2017

paragraph: Hurricane Andrew caused $ 26 billion in damage.
author: Inforbae, 2017

paragraph: Hurricane Andrew destroyed 49,000 houses, damaged another 108,000 and left 1.4 million people without electricity for days.
author: Inforbae, 2017

title: Hurricane Maria
paragraph: 2975 people died in the island as a consequence of Hurricane Maria on september, 2017.
author: BBC, 2018

paragraph: Harvard ensures that at least 4645 people died in Puerto Rico due to Hurricane María. The number exceeds the 64 victims that the government reconized last year.
author: BBC, 2018

paragraph: Almost a year after the Hurricane Maria devastated Puerto Rico, autorities informed that the electric energy has been restablized to almost all the residents in the island.
author: CNN Español, 2018

title: Java earthquake
paragraph: 27 May 2006, total numbers of deaths: 5778
author: The guardian, UK

title: Kashmir earthquake

title: Hurricane Katrina
paragraph: 29 August 2005, total numbers of deaths: 1833
author: The guardian, UK

paragraph: New Orleans (Louisiana) could not stand the rising water due to the impact of Hurricane Katrina.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: The speed of the winds of Katrina, ascended to category 4 and touched down with winds superior to 225 kilometers per hour.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: The deaths caused by Katrina were 1,577 in Louisiana, 238 in Mississippi, 2 in Alabama, 2 in Georgia and 14 in Florida.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: In the metropolitan area of New Orleans lived 1.3 million people before Hurricane Katrina. The mayor of the city ordered to evacuate it. 80% of the population left their homes.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: New Orleans became the city of the United States with the most concentration of abandoned houses after the Katrina hurricane.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: The economic impact in material damages of the hurricane Katrina is estimated in 146,000 million dollars, according to the calculation of the bank Morgan Stanley.
author: El País, 2015

paragraph: Before Katrina there where 323,300 blacks in the city, after the hurricane only 223,700 lived there.
author: El País, 2015

title: Mumbai floods
paragraph: 26 July 2005, total numbers of deaths: 1200
author: The guardian, UK

title: South Asian tsunami
paragraph: 26 December 2004, total numbers of deaths: 226408
author: The guardian, UK

title: Bam earthquake
paragraph: 26 December 2003, total numbers of deaths: 26796
author: The guardian, UK

title: European heatwave
paragraph: Summer 2003, total numbers of deaths: 72210
author: The guardian, UK

title: Dresden floods
paragraph: 11 August 2002, total numbers of deaths: 330108
author: The guardian, UK

title: Gujurat earthquake
paragraph: 26 January 2001, total numbers of deaths: 20005
author: The guardian, UK

paragraph: Between 1994 and 2013, EM-DAT recorded 6,873 natural disasters worldwide, which claimed 1.35 million lives or almost 68,000 lives on average each year.
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: 218 million people were affected by natural disasters on average per annum between 1994 y 2013
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: EM-DAT data show that flooding caused the majority of disasters between 1994 and 2013, accounting for 43% of all recorded events and affecting nearly 2.5 billion people
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: Storms were the second most frequent type of disaster, killing more than 244,000 people and costing US$936 billion in recorded damage.
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: Storms are the most expensive type of disaster during the past two decades and the second most costly in terms of lives lost
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: Earthquakes (including tsunamis) killed more people than all other types of disaster put together, claiming nearly 750,000 lives between 1994 and 2013.
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: Tsunamis were the most deadly sub-type of earthquake, with an average of 79 deaths for every 1,000 people affected, compared to four deaths per 1,000 for ground movements.
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: Tsunamis almost twenty times more deadly than ground movements
author: Reliefweb, New york, 2015

paragraph: In August, Hurricane Harvey left at least 47 people dead. Hurricane Irma devastated several cities in the Caribbean and South Florida, with more than 60 lives lost
author: BBC Brasil, Brasil, 2017

paragraph: According to meteorologist Bob Hensen, climate change has caused the increase in hurricane intensity in the last three decades.
author: BBC Brasil, Brasil, 2017

paragraph: 2005 was the year of most hurricanes -15 in total, including Katrina, which left at least 1,800 dead in the United States
author: BBC Brasil, Brasil, 2017

paragraph: According to the British Geological Survey,  every year an average of 15 earthquakes of magnitude greater than 7 occur
author: BBC Brasil, Brasil, 2017

title: Chile earthquake 1960
paragraph: In Chile, an earthquake measuring 9.5 on the Richter scale occurred on May 22, 1960.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake in Chile in 1960 caused 1,600 deaths and 3,000 injuries.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: 1960 Chile earthquake: 2 million people were left homeless, and generated a tsunami that caused 61 deaths in Hawaii and 138 in Japan.
author: El País, 2011

title: Alaska earthquake 1964
paragraph: In Alaska there was an earthquake on March 28, 1964 of 9.2 degrees.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake and subsequent tsunami in Alaska claimed 128 lives and caused $311 million in material losses.
author: El País, 2011

title: Chile earthquake 2010
paragraph: On February 27, 2010, an earthquake in Chile of 8.8 degrees occurred.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake in Chile in 2010, caused 523 deaths, 25 missing, 800,000 victims and losses of 30,000 million dollars.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake in Chile generated a giant wave that caused 180 fatalities in the coastal areas of the country and in the Juan Fernández archipelago.
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake in Chile in 2010 moved the axis of the Earth, shortened the duration of the days by 1.26 microseconds
author: El País, 2011

paragraph: The earthquake in Chile in 2010 displaced the city of Concepción three meters, and the capital Santiago in half a meter.
author: El País, 2011

title: Hurricane Harvey
paragraph: Causing about $125 billion in damage, Harvey ranks as the second-most costly hurricane to hit the U.S. mainland since 1900.
author: Worl Vision, 2018

paragraph: Harvey, the strongest hurricane to hit the U.S. since 2005, killed at least 103 people.
author: Bloomerg, 2018

title: Mocoa
paragraph: An avalanche of mud and water destroyed 40% of Mocoa, capital of Putumayo in 2017.
author: El Colombiano, 2018

paragraph: The avalanche in Mocoa, Putumayo in 2017 left 333 dead people, 76 missing people and 22310 victims.
author: El Colombiano, 2018

paragraph: China is the country where the greatest number of geophysical, hydrological and meteorological disasters occur
author: Statista, Germany

paragraph: The most traumatic disaster in 2015, in terms of fatalities, took place in Nepal in the form of an earthquake.
author: Statista, Germany

paragraph: More than 8,800 people lost their lives because of that seismic movement of April 2015 in Nepal
author: Statista, Germany

paragraph: The tsunami that occurred in Japan in 2011 caused damages amounting to 210,000 million US dollars, of which only 40,000 were insured
author: Statista, Germany
